data.name: Combinations
data.description:
# Combinations

Making a combination is selecting items from a collection, where the order of the items does not matter. ( This kata assumes all items in the collection are different. )

Imagine drawing a poker hand: `5` cards from a deck of `52` cards. All cards are different, and the order of the cards in the hand does not matter. ( The order of the cards in the deck does not matter either. The total number of different possibilities BTW is `52 * 51 * 50 * 49 * 48 / 5 / 4 / 3 / 2 / 1 ( = 52! / 47! / 5! )`. Full testing with drawing from a full deck of cards would therefore possibly overstress CodeWars a little. )

# Task

Implement an `Array` method `.combinations(n)` that returns a ( possibly empty ) `Aray` of all possible unique combinations of `n` items from an `Array`.

It should throw an `Error` when an invalid number `n` is specified; inputs should not be modified; the output should be a new `Array`.

# Examples

```
[ 0, 1 ].combinations(0) => [ [ ] ]
[ 0, 1 ].combinations(1) => [ [ 0 ], [ 1 ] ]
[ 0, 1 ].combinations(2) => [ [ 0, 1 ] ]
[ 0, 1 ].combinations(3) => [ ]
[ 0, 1 ].combinations(π) => Error()

[ "♠A", "♠K" .., "♣3", "♣2" ].combinations(5) => [ ["♥A","♥K","♥Q","♥J","♥10"] .. and 2 598 959 other hands ]
```

# Input validation

This being a class method, the array input will always be a valid array ( possibly of length `0` ). For this kata, assume all elements are different.

Valid inputs for `n` are non-negative integers. Tests will include invalid values for `n`.

# Testing failures

If you are seeing stray `[Function]` elements in test failure messages, look into [enumerability](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Enumerability_and_ownership_of_properties). The bare presence of these elements is not the cause of any failures though.

# Preloaded

In the `Preloaded` section, `sorted` is defined, that sorts the output from the `.combinations()` method. This is used in the default `Example Tests` as well as in the `Submit Tests`, so the order of the array elements or the array element elements does not matter, as matters not the order of the items in the collection or in the combinations.
